results.title: Neat on Paper
results.creator_credit: James Kesteven, Mandy King, Miriana Marusic and Sydney Filmmakers' Co-op Action Group
results.brief_description: The Sydney Filmmakers’ Co-operative was a major national agency for the distribution and exhibition of independently produced Australian film and video for over 20 years. This program examines the issues surrounding its closure in 1986.

results.title: Australian animals dreaming stories
results.brief_description: First Nations peoples used stories to teach their children about the laws and myths of their land. Pauline McLeod tells five stories about unique Australian animals. Each story is laced with colourful drawings. The stories featured are: ‘The Giant goanna and the black snake’; ‘The Platypus’; ‘How the kangaroo got its pouch’; ‘Why does the kookaburra laugh?’; ‘The Bunyip’.

results.title: Telephone technique
results.creator_credit: Wesley Greene, Crawley Films and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Part of a series on sales training, this episode deals with telephone training for retail sales clerks. It emphasizes good telephone manners, wide knowledge of stock, importance of correct customer name and address and the necessity for an intelligent descriptive vocabulary when speaking of merchandise over the telephone.

results.title: Bushland fantasy
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Soundmasters
results.brief_description: Provides glimpses of the many wild flowers and animals found in the Australian bush. Includes photographs of native flora, and animal life such as kangaroos, wallabies, platypus, lyrebirds and koalas. Many of these can be found in the wildlife sanctuary at Healesville where special efforts are made to arrange a proper diet for these animals. Narrated by John Dudley.

results.title: Homosexuality: a film for discussion
results.brief_description: Designed to dispel the myths about homosexuality. Homosexuals talk about their lives, their relationships and the difficulties of growing up gay in an oppressive, intolerant society. Parents of gays speak out and the Melbourne public expresses its view on the subject.

results.title: The Life of Harry Dare
results.creator_credit: Aleski Vellis, Terry J. Charatsis, Australian Film Commission, Infinity Pictures and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Harry Dare’s troubles began the day he sighted the Kombi van and despite the warnings of ‘Bad Spirit Trouble’, he just had to have it. When the van is stolen, Harry embarks on a journey with his young estranged son Jim to find it. What Harry really discovers is a more meaningful relationship with his son. Stars John Moore as Harry and Aaron Wilton as Jim.

results.title: Behind the menu
results.brief_description: A survey of the use of gas in commercial cooking and industrial establishments. The film includes glimpses of what happens “behind the menu” at establishments like the Menzies Hotel, The Royal Melbourne Hospital, the canteen at General Motors and a biscuit factory.

results.title: Boys and Balls
results.creator_credit: Sue Thomson, Anna Grieve, Film Finance Corporation Australia, Gil Scrine Films and Thermal Falls
results.brief_description: It is in games many men discover their paradise. Robert Lynd. H.G. Nelson (Greig Pickhaver) and Rampaging Roy Slaven (John Doyle) host an amusing, often hilarious exploration of the fascination of men with balls; whether it is a cricket, football, tennis, basketball, soccer, bowls, table tennis, hockey or golf ball! Celebrities including Ted Whitten, Ron Barassi, Merv Hughes, Derek Kickett, Andrew Gaze, Lindsay Gaze, Francis Awaritife, Brad Mackay, Greg Champion and the average bloke and kid next door share favourite childhood memories of their sporting idols, humerous moments, coaching temperaments, the importance of rules and umpiring, and the incidence of sporting violence. Interviews, archival footage and famous quotes are intermixed in this perceptive program.

results.title: Shadow on the reef. Turning turtle.
results.creator_credit: Richard Dennison, ABC-TV (Australia), National Geographic Society and Orana Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Blue wilderness”.
“Shadow on the reef” looks at the incredible Whale Shark, the world’s largest shark. Valerie and Ron Taylor explore the wonders of the deep below the coral reef, emphasising the message that this fragile ecology is increasingly under threat.
“Turning Turtle” sees Ron and Valerie Taylor at odds with the Queensland Government over the fate of turtles on coral islands, with a focus on Raine Island. The Green Turtles are a rare and ancient species and the fight to save them pits the Taylors against bureaucracy and harsh physical conditions.

results.title: Bridging the gap: the many worlds of Mandawuy
results.creator_credit: Kevin Ryder, John Walsh and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face the press”.
Paolo Totaro hosts a discussion between Rhoda Roberts (Vox Populi), Sonia Voumard (The Age) and Mandawauy Yunupingu (teacher, musician, ambassador and father).
Mandawuy explores the ways he is bridging the gap between black and white culture through both his band Yothu Yindi, and as the Principal of the Yirrkala Community School in North East Arnhem Land, where, he devised the curriculum mix of First Nations peoples’ and western studies known as “Both Ways Education”.
